availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George R. Suttles (Oldham County, Kentucky, shoemaker, farmer, and soldier)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, shoemaker, farmer, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Berry Suttles. Father of James Suttles, Elias Suttles, Frances E. Suttles, Michael Suttles, Elizabeth Suttles, George Suttles, John Suttles, Nancy Suttles, Melissa Suttles, Sally Suttles, Alice Suttles, and Richard Suttles. Shoemaker in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and sergeant from December 31, 1861 to May 1, 1864. Wounded at the Battle of Huff's Ferry, Roane County, Tennessee on November 14, 1863. Transferred to the Veterans Reserve Corps on May 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 2, p. 124A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 872-3.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, La Grange, p. 65B-66A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0268.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994051, Oldham County Births.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 870.
